intro: Zingiber mizoramense, commonly known as the Mizoram ginger, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
